title: Whether you have an iPhone or need one, these Prime Day deals have you covered
content:
Macworld

Amazon’s big Prime Day sale is on and running until midnight today (July 17). There are lots of discounted products and deals—some of them good, some of them no better than you would find the rest of the year.

If you’re looking for a new iPhone you may be wondering if the iPhone is on sale for Prime Day. The answer to this question depends on where you are based. If you’re in the U.S., Amazon is not the place to go to buy a new iPhone, however, in other countries, including the U.K., you will find the latest iPhones at Amazon at lower prices than Apple sells them for. iPhone deals are available year-round, but it isn’t usually until Prime Day that the deals are better at Amazon than from carriers and other retailers.

In the U.K., you can find the latest iPhones unlocked at Amazon and at other resellers. Supplies can be limited, and there are usually only small discounts for the newest handsets, but you might see some good deals on the older iPhone models such as the iPhone 14, iPhone 13, and iPhone SE. You can see current deals on various iPhones below. If you aren’t sure which iPhone to buy take a look at our iPhone buying guide and our comparison of every iPhone handset.

The iPhone models and accessories here are all chosen by our editors, who have decades of experience with Apple devices. We’ve reviewed every Apple product we recommend and we won’t tell you to buy something that’s not an actual deal. The products below are all at or near all-time lows, and we’ve selected what we think is the best configuration for each product type. We know Apple is expensive, so we’ve chosen products at prices we would be willing to pay, so you can trust that our recommendations will steer you in the right direction—and save you big bucks.

First published on Friday, July 12. Updated Wednesday, July 17.

Best iPhone deals of Amazon Prime Day

If you’re in the U.K. the iPhone is on sale for Prime Day. These are the best Prime Day iPhone deals we’ve seen so far:

  • iPhone 15 (128GB): £681 (£118 off; RRP £799)
  • iPhone 15 Plus (128GB): £799 (£100 off; RRP £899)
  • iPhone 15 Pro (128GB): £899 (£100 off; RRP £999)
  • iPhone 15 Pro Max (256GB): £1,059 (£140 off; RRP £1,199)
  • iPhone 14 Plus (128 GB), Red, Blue, Midnight, Purple, Starlight: £569 (£230 off, RRP £799) PRIME DAY DEAL
  • iPhone 14 Pro (256GB): £999 (£210 off; RRP was £1,209)
  • iPhone 13 (512GB): £739 (£160 off; RRP £899) PRIME DAY DEAL

Amazon U.S. has a collaboration to offer the same deal you get on the Boost Infinite site: $60/month gets you a “free” iPhone 15 Pro with no trade-in required, paid for in bill credits over 3 years with an option to upgrade (and start the cycle over) every year.

In order to take advantage of some Prime Day deals, you need to be an Amazon Prime member. Amazon Prime costs $14.99 / £8.99 / AUD$6.99 on a monthly basis (but can be canceled after 30 days) and gives you two-day free delivery and access to Prime Video.

For all the best Prime Day deals on Apple products see our round-up of the Best Prime Day Apple Deals.

Prime Day: Best iPhone accessory deals

While Amazon doesn’t sell the latest iPhone 15 in the U.S. outside of the partnership with Boost Infinite, Prime Day can be a great time to get iPhone accessories. Here are the best sales we’re tracking.

  • Beats Studio Pro: $170 ($180 off) PRIME DAY DEAL
  • Anker MagGo 3-in-1 Wireless charging station: $72 ($28 off) PRIME DAY DEAL
  • Baseus 10,000mAh 30W Magnetic power bank: $35 ($11 off)
  • AirTag (single): $24 ($6 off)
  • AirTags (4-pack): $75 ($25 off)
  • Anker Nano II 45W USB-C charger: $19 ($21 off) PRIME DAY DEAL
  • MagSafe Charger: $33 ($6 off, MSRP $39)
  • Anker 10ft USB-C charge cable: $9 ($3 off) PRIME DAY DEAL

Prime Day: Best iPhone 15 deals

In the U.S., Amazon has sold the iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Pro with Boost Infinite for three years. It’s not a bad deal—you’ll get up to $1,000 off whichever model you choose without needing an old device to trade in and will be able to upgrade to a newer model after 12 months of service. Plans cost $60 per line for unlimited talk, text, and data on AT&T and T-Mobile’s networks.

Here are the best deals we could find on Amazon in the U.K. on iPhone 15 models:

  • iPhone 15 (128GB): £681 (£118 off; RRP £799)
  • iPhone 15 Plus (128GB): £799 (£100 off; RRP £899)
  • iPhone 15 Pro (128GB): £899 (£100 off; RRP £999)
  • iPhone 15 Pro Max (256GB): £1,059 (£140 off; RRP £1,199)

For more deals take a look at our iPhone 15 deals in the U.S. and iPhone 15 deals in the U.K.

Prime Day: Best iPhone 14 deals

In the U.S., the iPhone 14 models you find on Amazon are either used or refurbished. In the U.K., these are the best deals we could find:

  • iPhone 14 (128GB): £599 (£100 off; RRP £699)
  • iPhone 14 Plus (128 GB), Red, Blue, Midnight, Purple, Starlight: £569 (£230 off, RRP £799) PRIME DAY DEAL
  • iPhone 14 Pro (256GB): £999 (£210 off; RRP was £1,209)
  • iPhone 14 Pro Max (256GB): £1,188.77 (£10.23 off; RRP was £1,199)

Every month we round up the best iPhone 14 deals.

Prime Day: Best iPhone 13 deals

In the U.S., you may find some used iPhone 13 models on Amazon. In the U.K., these are the best deals we could find:

  • iPhone 13 (128GB): £499 (£100 off; RRP £599)
  • iPhone 13 (512GB): £739 (£160 off; RRP £899) PRIME DAY DEAL

Find deals on more iPhone 13 handsets in our monthly round-up here: iPhone 13 and iPhone 13 Pro deals.

Prime Day: Best iPhone SE deals

For those on a budget, or who just really want Touch ID instead of Face ID, there’s the iPhone SE from 2022. It’s as fast as the iPhone 14, but with an older design that has huge bezels, and a more limited camera. You won’t find it on Amazon U.S. but U.K. readers should check the deals in our monthly round-up of the best iPhone SE deals and below.

  • iPhone SE (64GB): £379 (£50 off; RRP £429)

Prime Day: How can I get the best iPhone deals?

Many items in the Amazon Prime Day Sale are only open to Prime members, so you’ll need to sign in with an active membership to purchase one of the deals. Prime memberships cost $139 / £95 / AUD$59 annually, or $14.99 / £8.99 / AUD$6.99 every month. New users can sign up for a 30-day free trial that can be canceled at any time during the trial window. You’ll also get free one or two-day delivery and access to Amazon Prime Video and all that content.

One tip when you click on a good deal—even if it’s from a Macworld page—is to check that the product isn’t redirected to a refurbished model, and the current manufacturer’s price is listed, as that can make the price drop look a lot better than it is.

Prime Day 2024: Our favorite deals

We’ve been tracking iPhone deals for years and know a good one when we see it. Throughout the Prime Day sale, we constantly check Amazon’s listings to find the best deals. We’ve tested all of the models we recommend here and only select the very best deals for publication—so if you see an iPhone listed here, you’ll know it’s at or near its all-time low price.
